alert.note: Alert for Florence; Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Marathon; Oneida; Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 10 at 1:46PM CST until January 11 at 9:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...COLD CONDITIONS EXPECTED THIS EVENING INTO TUESDAY MORNING... .The combination of cold air and winds will produce wind chill values of 15 below zero to 25 below zero at times this evening and overnight into Tuesday morning. Wind chills will drop to 20 below zero or colder this evening, rise for a period overnight as winds diminish, and fall to 20 below or colder again late tonight as winds increase. Air temperatures will quick rise above zero late Tuesday morning, ending this stretch of very cold temperatures. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills ranging from 15 below to 25 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and northeast Wisconsin. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 9 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Wear appropriate winter clothing, cover exposed skin, and dress in layers if going outdoors. Keep pets indoors as much as possible.
